Anyone who is having problem 
'Cannot find Gamedata/configs/system.itx' when starting the game from crack
here is what to do: 

Create a shortcut from the crack "xrEngine.exe" to the desktop.

After this go to desktop --> xrEngine -->click properties --> change the start in dir from "C:\S.T.A.L.K.E.R. - Call of Pripyat\bin" to "C:\S.T.A.L.K.E.R. - Call of Pripyat\"
Start the game from the shortcut

Worked for me. Hope this helps

This game is amazing, the graphics are amazing, the storyline is amazing, the gameplay is amazing, just, wow... What a fucking great game. I found that installing a couple of mods that use there own user.ltx files and other .ltx files actually help make the game a little stabler. Also, if your crashing because of the user.ltx file start the setup on the cd and it will bypass that problem by launching the game.

Great game, finished it this week. Downloaded, installed, applied crack, absolutely no problems.

Although it does lack some of those finer things from the previous games, the major upgrade on the world itself and the A-Life is just awesome. Finally they added in unscripted random occurences that the modding team tried so hard to add to the previous games.

I did find this game a little to easy though, I mean, at first it was kinda tough but as you progress, its soooo easy to make money, and you can just get nimble to order you in the best shit in the game right at the start. Halfway through the game I had all the best gear, 2/3rd upgraded (cant upgrade the last 1/3rd till pripyat), playing on master mode, found it way too easy.

When you hit pripyat, the game gets even easier because its throws a 1 hit kill gauss rifle at you and because its so easy to make money you just buy infinite batteries for it, anything that gets in your way is dead 1 hit kill. Also the exoskeleton can be upgraded to let you run, which makes you now a running tank, instead of a walking tank like the other games.

Even though I did find it pretty easy and a pretty unbalenced, I still really enjoyed just exploring the zone. Hopefully a modding team will release another mod that ups the difficulty and balences out the game a bit more.

Yay, the English version! Already played through the Russian version with cheats and all (because I didn't know what the hell to do..) Going to play it through again, and hopefully actually understand what I played..

The game itself isn't that great at all, very comparable with the previous two in the series. Graphics are so-so, and the gameplay is a bit.. Sturdy, I guess. They did a better job at recreating the actual Chernobyl atmosphere this time though! And that atmosphere is the single  reason why I play this game. Can't get enough of this setting, even though I have been in Chernobyl in real life already! 

I wouldn't recommend this game for people who focus on graphics, but more for people who love the setting. There are way better games out there. 6/10. Thanks loads though, Razor1911!

Windows 7 Pirates, my solution for the fsgame.ltx problem is the following:

copy your fsgame.ltx from the pripyat's main folder to your desktop

open this file and at the end of the line

$app_data_root$         = true | false | C:\Users\Public\Documents\S.T.A.L.K.E.R. - Call of Pripyat\

add "bin" just that it states:

$app_data_root$         = true | false | C:\Users\Public\Documents\S.T.A.L.K.E.R. - Call of Pripyat\bin

Save these changes by pressing ctrl-s. Now copy the new desktop fsgame.LTX-file back to the pripyat main directory overwriting the previous not correct file.

Now you can run stalker from Stalker-COP.exe and it will surely work. So don't call me surely, but a thanks would be nice.

Enjoy and buy the game eventually.

I had the same problem with the engine failing. This is how I got it to work.

  1. Install the game. During the prompt where you have to insert the CD-Key, do not inser a name.
   2. Browse the to folder where the game stored user data. by default this is C:\Users\USERNAME\Documents\S.T.A.L.K.E.R. - Call of Pripyat (if you installed the game for all users, look under C:\Users\Public\Documents\S.T.A.L.K.E.R. - Call of Pripyat\)
   3. Delete everything inside this folder including subfolders and files (if any)
   4. Now launch the game using Stalker-COP.exe located in the game?s installation directory

The has been alot of trouble with this user.ltx file.
When I start the Stalker-COP.exe file, it crashes. I found out why.

C:\Users\Public\Documents\S.T.A.L.K.E.R. - Call of Pripyat
- is where the file is located. Alot of fixes include deleting this file before you start the game up, but this also sets the renderer to DX8 (Static Lighting). If I start the game, edit that setting to anything else, I won't be able to start the game again without deleting the user.ltx file. This will also clear all my other settings, including keybindings.

If I wanna keep the rest of the settings, I open my user.ltx file with any texteditor, locate the renderer command and delete it.

This will of course make the game use DX8 and look like shit, so if anyone found a way to run it in anything else than that, please tell me.

Quick resume on the x-ray engine error:
On some Windows 7 computers, you won't be able to start the game in anything but DX8 (Static Lighting).

This is why deleting user.ltx helps. When you start the game, it generates a config that uses Static Lighting.

The command for this is "renderer" in user.ltx. Change it to "renderer renderer_r1" and the game will boot all fine.

ok for people having trouble with win7, with errors and everything, here is what I did and it made it run perfectly. Go into your program files where the game is installed at and the file named Stalker-COP right click is and go to properties, then go to compatibility at the top and at the bottom of that screen you will see a "run as admi" box, click that. Then what I did was I went into my documents to where a folder called "Stalker-Call of Pripyat" and deleted it. Finally you click the old file "Stalker-COP" and the game should run fine.

The crack (the file in the Razor911 folder) needs to go into the /bin directory and overwrite the xrEngine file there.

For those who still get crashes: 

1) Go to the root folder and make a new text document. Write this in it: "start bin/xrEngine" without the quotes. Save the file as "start.cmd" and use this to launch the game from now on.

2) If you still get crashes, go to [hard drive letter here]/Users/Public/ and delete folder in there that has anything to do with STALKER Call of Pripyat. 

After I did both of these, I tried launching with the STALKER-COP.exe and the xrEngine loaded up but didn't crash. However, the engine didn't do shit even after I left out of xfire. I loaded up the start.cmd and the game works perfectly now. This was all done on Windows Vista Home 32bit but I'm sure it should work for you all as well. Cheers.
